abstract.text: Learn about the latest changes to enabling your app to be the system default.

inlineContent.text: Build apps and extensions that people can configure as the default app for many common tasks. Browse
that enable your apps to declare that they can be set as the system default.
Use
to link directly to your app’s settings, including the Default App option, where applicable. The new
option in
opens the global Default Apps settings panel.
Read
to see how to register your app to be the default responder to navigation requests for users in the European Union. This article explains how to use the
URL scheme to handle navigation queries the user initiates from other apps.
Learn about
so that your translation app can respond to user requests to perform text translation.

Alternative app marketplace apps for iOS or iPadOS enable users to install other third-party apps in the European Union. Developers can distribute their marketplace app on the web, and users can then select the alternative marketplace as their default, if desired. Apple provides the
framework that facilitates the secure installation of apps that your marketplace distributes. Read
to learn how to build your own marketplace.
Learn about the
entitlement used by alternative app marketplaces.
Read
to learn how to ship the alternative app marketplace.

In iOS and iPadOS 18.2 and later, a user may select an app other than the Phone or FaceTime apps to place calls. If your app places phone calls, for instance using services such as Voice over IP (VoIP), and you wish to optionally become the default calling app, see

content.text: Contactless NFC and SE platform apps

inlineContent.text: iOS 18.1 introduced APIs that support secure contactless transactions within compatible iOS apps using the NFC & SE Platform for in-store payments, car keys, closed-loop transit, corporate badges, student IDs, home keys, hotel keys, merchant loyalty and rewards, and event tickets, with government IDs to be available at a later date.

The NFC & SE Platform is a secure solution developed by Apple that enables authorized developers to provide capabilities, such as securely adding, storing, and presenting a contactless card for NFC use cases, from within their iOS app. Supported NFC and SE platform apps can be selected by users as their default handler for these transactions.
To learn more about the NFC and SE Platform see
Manage and employ Secure Element credentials with contactless transaction capabilities using
Enable your app to be the default app for contactless NFC and SE Platform transactions with the
entitlement.

iOS 17.4 introduced APIs that support contactless transactions for in-store payments, car keys, tickets, and more uses from within compatible iOS apps using host card emulation (HCE) in the European Economic Area (EEA).
The
API in the CoreNFC framework enables authorized developers to perform contactless transactions from within their app. Supported
apps can be selected by users as their default handler for these transactions.
Learn about host card emulation apps by reading
Use
to enable host card emulation (HCE) transactions in your app.
Enable your app to be the default app for HCE-based contactless NFC with the
entitlement.
In iOS and iPadOS 18.2 and later, a user may select an app other than the Messages app to send instant messages. The system launches the default messaging app to handle when a user taps an
link from another app.
describes how to enable your app to optionally be selected as the default.
Build a Call Directory app extension so a user’s device can automatically use your app to look up incoming callers, present useful caller ID information, or block unwanted callers. Read
for more information on creating these app extensions.
You can specify that your Call Directory app extension adds identification and blocks phone numbers in its implementation of
To block incoming calls for a specific phone number, use the
method in the implementation of

Use custom keyboard apps and extensions to replace the system keyboard for users that want different text-entry capabilities, such as a novel input method. People can choose to have this custom keyboard available systemwide, and select the default keyboard used in text fields. Read
for information on how to build and configure your custom keyboard app and extension project.
For more information on handling expected system behaviors in your custom keyboard, see
The system launches the default mail client whenever a user opens a
link. Signal your app’s intent to be available as a default mail client by using the
entitlement.

content.text: Password, credential, and verification code apps

inlineContent.text: Password managers, verification code providers, and other secure credential apps can include a Password AutoFill app extension to enable their app to automatically fill in a name and password within Safari and other apps.
Register the
or
URL scheme within your app to enable setup of verification codes.
Use Xcode to add a new extension target of type
to your app’s project to enable AutoFill for secure credentials throughout the system.
For your app and app extension, use
to ask someone for permission to fill in the credentials.

Users can select an app to be their default web browser. To make your app available as the default browser app, confirm that your app meets the requirements below, then request a managed entitlement. See
to learn more.
In iOS 18.2 and iPadOS 18.2, the

API allows a browser app to check if it is currently the default browser app. To reduce the likelihood that users will face continuous requests to set a browser as their default, this API will only tell the browser app if it is the default once per year.
See
to see how your browser app can import data the user exported from Safari.
Use the
entitlement to enable your app to be the default web browser.

abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the app may, with user permission, provide user names and passwords for AutoFill in Safari and other apps.
A Boolean that indicates whether the app can act as a user’s default email client.
The entitlement that enables an app to vend other apps as an alternative app marketplace.
A Boolean value indicating whether your app can be a default app for contactless NFC with the card session API.
A Boolean value that indicates whether your app that uses the SecureElementCredential framework can become the default contactless app.
A Boolean that indicates whether the app can act as the user’s default web browser.
Adds a blocking entry with the specified phone number.
Tells the extension to prepare for a host app’s request.
Configure your CallKit or LiveCommunicationKit app so people can set it as the default calling app on their device.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Preparing your app to be the default calling app

abstract.text: Create a Call Directory app extension to identify and block incoming callers by their phone number.
An ISO 7816 card emulation session.
Configure your navigation app so people can set it as the default on their devices.

abstract.text: Create an alternative app marketplace, distribute your app on an alternative app marketplace, or distribute your app from your website.

abstract.text: Transfer bookmarks, saved passwords, and other information between browsers.

abstract.text: Reports whether this app is the person’s default app in the given category.
The URL string used to select a default app in the Settings app.
The URL string you use to deep link to your app’s custom settings in the Settings app.
Design a flexible, functional, and responsive interface for editing text.
Add an extension to your Xcode project to provide systemwide customized text input.
Configure your browser app so users can set it as the default on their device instead of Safari.

abstract.text: Enable the distribution of other third-party apps from within your marketplace app.
Configure your app and website to enable people to install your app on their devices from your website.
